properties.areaDesc: Northeast Highlands; Harding County; Southwest Chaves County; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Central Highlands; Guadalupe County; Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; South Central Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 2:34AM MST until February 4 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...MORE SNOW EXPECTED FOR NORTH CENTRAL AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO...

.A storm system will bring wintry weather to the northern
mountains, Upper Rio Grande Valley, and portions of eastern New
Mexico through this evening. Up to 8 inches of snowfall is
possible across the peaks and west facing slopes while up to 4
inches could fall in the high valleys with lesser amounts across
the eastern highlands and plains. Temperatures will stay below
freezing today which will cause roadways to become icy and
snowpacked, especially along the I-25 corridor from Las Vegas to
Raton Pass as well as mountain passes.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches,
but up to 5 inches along the east slopes of the Sangre De
Cristos, in the South Central Mountains and near Raton Pass.
Winds gusting as high as 35 mph near the South Central
Mountains.

* WHERE...East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Central
Highlands, South Central Mountains, Johnson and Bartlett Mesas
Including Raton Pass, Far Northeast Highlands, Northeast
Highlands, Harding County, Eastern San Miguel County,
Guadalupe County and Southwest Chaves County.

* WHEN...Until 8 PM MST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Icy and snowpacked roads may cause hazardous travel
conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of falling and blowing
snow may reduce visibility below 2 miles.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING
